skill.name: STAR Story Extraction
skill.description: Auto-invoke after task completion to extract interview-ready STAR stories from completed work.
skill.summary: Auto-invoke after task completion to extract interview-ready STAR stories from completed work.
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This skill consists of a single markdown documentation file with no executable code, no network access, no file system operations, and no external command execution. It is purely a prompt-based skill that guides users through creating interview-ready STAR stories.

content.value_statement: Developers struggle to recall their accomplishments during interviews. This skill transforms completed work into structured STAR stories that demonstrate problem-solving ability.
actual_capabilities: Identifies story type based on problem solved (technical, performance, security, refactor)
Guides user through Situation, Task, Action, Result framework with specific questions
Provides quality checklist to ensure story completeness
Offers template for consistent story format and documentation
Suggests interview variations each story can address
Captures stories in markdown files organized by date and feature name
limitations: Does not auto-generate stories from git logs or code history
Requires user to actively recall and describe their work
Does not integrate with external job platforms or application systems
No automated metric tracking or progress analytics

use_cases.title: Prepare for behavioral interviews
use_cases.description: Transform recent project work into structured stories that demonstrate problem-solving skills during job interviews.

use_cases.title: Translate past experience
use_cases.description: Reframe previous work accomplishments into technicalSTAR stories that highlight transferable skills.

use_cases.title: Document team achievements
use_cases.description: Capture individual contributions and project outcomes to support performance reviews and promotion cases.

prompt_templates.title: Basic project story
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a STAR story for the [feature name] I just completed. Guide me through Situation, Task, Action, and Result.

prompt_templates.title: Challenge-focused story
prompt_templates.prompt: I solved a challenging bug in [component]. Walk me through creating a STAR story that shows my debugging approach.

prompt_templates.title: Technical depth story
prompt_templates.prompt: I improved [system] performance by [metric]. Help me structure a STAR story that highlights the technical decisions I made.

prompt_templates.title: Leadership story
prompt_templates.prompt: I mentored a junior developer on [task]. Create a STAR story that demonstrates my leadership and technical guidance.

output_examples.input: Help me create a STAR story for the authentication system I built last month.
output: Situation: Our SaaS application was experiencing a 40% drop-off during signup because the existing form had poor UX and no real-time validation.
Task: I was responsible for rebuilding the entire authentication flow, focusing on reducing friction while maintaining security.
Action: I implemented a multi-step form with real-time validation using React Hook Form. I added JWT authentication with secure refresh token rotation.
Result: Sign-up completion improved by 35%, with zero authentication-related security incidents since launch.

best_practices: Use specific technologies and technical details to demonstrate expertise.
Quantify results with metrics whenever possible (percentages, numbers, time savings).
Focus on your individual contributions while acknowledging team context.
anti_patterns: Using "we" instead of "I" which dilutes your personal contribution.
Making stories too long (aim for 2-3 minutes when spoken).
Forgetting to include the result or impact of your work.

faq.question: What is the STAR method?
faq.answer: STAR stands for Situation, Task, Action, Result. It is a structured framework for answering behavioral interview questions by describing the context, your role, what you did, and the outcome.

faq.question: How many STAR stories do I need?
faq.answer: Prepare 5-8 diverse stories covering different skills and challenges. This ensures you have relevant examples for various interview questions.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with Claude Code after完成任务?
faq.answer: Yes. Invoke this skill after completing any significant task to immediately capture the story while details are fresh in your mind.

faq.question: Is my data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Stories are saved locally to your mentorspec directory. No data is sent to external services. Your career stories remain private.

faq.question: How is this different from resume writing?
faq.answer: Resumes summarize what you did. STAR stories explain how you did it. They provide the narrative depth that resumes cannot include.

faq.question: What story types should I prepare?
faq.answer: Include stories for technical challenges, performance optimizations, security fixes, learning curve moments, and collaboration or leadership situations.
